From: Tobias Nipkow <nipkow@in.tum.de>
We are looking for a Ph.D. student or postdoctoral researcher to work on the
analysis of randomized algorithms in the theorem prover Isabelle.

We shall be investigating programming logics for randomized algorithms, case
studies, and the formalization of probability theory. We will build on the
existing formalization of probability theory in Isabelle.

The successful candidate will have a strong background in one of the following
two areas

  • verification
  • randomized algorithms
    and basic knowledge of the other area and will be keen to bridge the gap between
    them.

The position will be filled as soon as possible.

Please send informal enquiries or formal applications (including the usual
material and the names of two references) directly to me.

Best regards,
Tobias Nipkow
http://www.in.tum.de/~nipkow/
